page.title: 13Building Survey
page.content: Mrs James took our group to Balsall Street East junction where we were going to observe the buildings along Station Road to Needlers End Lane. Our job was to find out if the buildings were very old, Victorian, 1920's/30', 1950's or modern. We started to view the buildings on one side. Many houses were extremely interesting. One lady told us about a bench mark that was printed on one of the walls of her house. Apparently a bench mark was put there to measure the height of the surrounding land. Another interesting point was an old Tudor house. The craftsmanship on it was lovely, the house also had its own coat of arms. Alongside the house there was a barn,it had the same charm as the house. This Tudor building seemed to clash with the modern houses all around.
